messages: 10ed83979f1f83493d8bc2cba661c9dc (09:18): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: has anyone been in here recently asking about localstorage and concurrency?
10ed83979f1f83493d8bc2cba661c9dc (09:18): the topic has come up on a chromium mailing list, i guess it is complicated.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:18): sicking mentioned it a few weeks ago
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:19): the spec right now just assumes a global lock that is released by the script ending
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:19): which i guess isn't so hot
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:19): what does IE8 do?
10ed83979f1f83493d8bc2cba661c9dc (09:19): not sure
10ed83979f1f83493d8bc2cba661c9dc (09:19): good question
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (09:23): aargh. The release version of IE8 shows the compatibility view button even with the HTML5 doctype
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (09:23): didn't the Windows 7 RC not do that?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:38): moves the web workers source document into the html5 source document
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:49): ok my script now generates
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:49): 2 whatwg specs
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:50): 5 w3c specs
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:50): 1 ietf spec
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:50): a validation report
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:50): diffs
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:50): checks for broken links
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:50): and checks for how many issues were added or removed
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (09:50): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: you can then publish the full thing as a "compilation" of 6 specs :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:51): that's what i validate :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:56): and my commit script commits to two subversion repos, five cvs repos, and submits the I-D to the IETF system
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:56): oh and generates the multipage version
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:57): oh and my main script also gets the pubrules check on the main html5 spec
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:57): and there's a cronjob that counts issues and makes pdfs
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:57): ok bed time now
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:57): nn

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:14): can someone help me understand why http:/ b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9.iki.fi/html5-lecture/html5-tml.ogg works in Firefox, in XiphQT and in VLC on Mac but not in VLC on Windows or VLC on Linux?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (10:20): confirms that it doesn't work with vlc on windows but works with mplayer on windows
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:20): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Define "works"
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:20): It started playing with VLC/linux for me
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:21): but I don't think sound was working
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:21): But that could be my system
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (10:21): yes it plays but it looks like garbage
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (10:23): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: is there any sound?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (10:30): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: mplayer says the video is 0:47:14 long but it plays beond that

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:32): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: there should be 1024*768@15fps video and mono audio. I only get audio in VLC on Intrepid and Windows 7
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:33): the right duration is 1:36:11
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:33): oops. bad "only" placement
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:34): in VLC on Intrepid and Windows 7, audio plays, video does not
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:34): in Firefox on Mac and Windows 7, both audio and video play
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:34): in VLC and QiphQT on Mac, both audio and video play
e2633ed61085592add6e058692dfff2f (10:34): yeah, plays fine in ff on linux here
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:35): could it be that the video is CPU-intensive and VLC drops video altogether if it can't play it in real time?
e2633ed61085592add6e058692dfff2f (10:37): where is it not playing?
e2633ed61085592add6e058692dfff2f (10:37): it works in mplayer, vlc and ff for me
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:38): e2633ed61085592add6e058692dfff2f: video doesn't play on Intrepid on older computer and doesn't play on Windows 7 (on virtual machine)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:39): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: It plays on VLC/Intrepid for me
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:39): I can't test the audi though as VLC is complaining oss audio output error: cannot open audio device (/dev/dsp)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:40): hmm. video plays on intrepid totem on a VM for me but not on older hardware
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:40): blames old hardware and moves on
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:42): Yeah it plays on totem for me too
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:42): wonders how to fix his audio problems
e2633ed61085592add6e058692dfff2f (10:46): see what has the audio device locked open?
e2633ed61085592add6e058692dfff2f (10:46): sudo lsof |grep snd
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:00): 0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17: That seemed to help, although it really didn't want to die

0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (11:01): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: you'll be happy to note that I haven't had a single sound problem since updating to jaunty (except two days ago, where everything went bonkers for all of five minutes)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:02): is slightly nervous to update a miachine he has to work on to a prerelease OS
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:02): So I guess I will wait a bit and then have sound joy in april (hopefully)
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (11:07): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: I wasn't suggesting you updated just yet :-)
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (11:08): I did so to circumvent other issues, particularily with multi-monitor support on my work machine
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (11:09): so far, I've not had any downtime at all
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:09): would also like to get multi-monitor support working better
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:09): Although that might be solvable without an upgrade
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (11:11): it's mostly solvable, except if you drag your machine around a lot
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:12): It seems that Ogg total duration display is rather broken in various apps
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:12): perhaps the ability to cat two ogg streams isn't such a great feature after all
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (11:15): ok, vlc has problems getting continuous playback of the audio
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (11:15): but video is fine
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (11:17): it's lost 1216 buffers a few minutes into the video
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (11:18): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I see you're encoding the audio at 8Khz
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (11:19): unless saving those megabytes is an extreme priority, I'd just use 44.1 or 48, given that a sound card usually has to upsample anyhow
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:19): 0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17: the orginal recording was 8 kHz
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:19): 0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17: recorded on Nokia N800
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:20): I'd love to know how to do this properly next time
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:20): with a bluetooth microphone and screen capture software that doesn't suck and can spool a couple of hours of screen data
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:21): or a new version of Keynote if the new version doesn't suck

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:23): When we did this kind of thing for a conference we ended up using some box that sat between the computer and the projector to capture the video. But that had the requirement that people be able to use their own laptops
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:23): so we couldn't install any special software
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:23): (and everyone wore a mic and we captured the audio from that somehow)
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (11:24): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: This was basically just a screencast, and meant as such, right?
e2633ed61085592add6e058692dfff2f (11:24): most ogg players don't handled cat'd streams well
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (11:24): convert your presentation to SVG? :P
